entry.title: Teatime Log, 2016-05-11
entry.content:
Where I work, we have just initiated Wednesday afternoon team-time sessions, where we can work on projects outside of our day-to-day work.

The idea started out as "team-time" but now we call it "tea-time" because that's more fun.

So, here are a few notes from my first teatime:

I'm a back-end developer who has, in the past, done as much as possible to avoid Drupal theming.

So teatime was a good chance for me to ask our in-house theming guru Pascal stupid questions :)

We're looking at ways in D7 and D8 to easily get data into html. In D7 this traditionally means page manager, panels and display suite. We've been working on ways to make this easier using a new approach, called "seem". More about this to come.

After teatime I watched this:

Aha! Understanding and Using Render Arrays in Drupal 8

... a great talk from yesterday at DrupalCon New Orleans ...

... that led me into this massive and very interested issue about the future of the render and theme system ...

Unify & simplify render & theme system: component-based rendering (enables pattern library, style guides, interface previews, client-side re-rendering)

It's a great read in itself. The issue summary includes this awesome quote:

understanding the entire flow is nearly impossible, and probably rivals the complexity of some simpler biological organisms

The discussion here is long and complicated but worth reading, because it is conducted in a very constructive way. I think this is due to the masterful way Wim Leers manages and frames the discussion.

There's a comment there about using twig in sculpin - that led me down the route of checking out sculpin and starting this blog.
